website_summaries.verdict: Mobile grab bar support around the bathroom. Can set up and position the grab bar as needed, making it great for anyone of any age.
pros: Suction cups naturally fit on any tile surface around the bathroom
cons: Suction cups are limited to tile surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe product!!!
customer_reviews.text: It almost caused my mom to have a bad fall in the shower! I had clamped it on securely to my mom's bathtub shower tiles and it seemed very secure. but after just one week one side just unclamped/uncupped itself from the wall as she came to hold it! My mom was very fortunate not to have had a horrible fall as she has bad knees and degenerative disc disease. This thing is not making it safer for people instead gives you a false sense of security and definitely is NOT secure. She took it off and threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: st

customer_reviews.title: Just OK.
customer_reviews.text: After a period of time, the suction cups release and the unit falls to the floor. Fortunately, the amount of time it holds is more than enough to complete a shower. To continue using the unit, we remove between showers. That seems to work.
customer_reviews.author: donald r. lovell

customer_reviews.title: Could not get these to remain sealed to my tiles
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to install in my shower for my elderly father-in-law during a recent visit. I install a similar product in his shower, and it has worked flawlessly on his tile shower wall. I was disappointed that these would not stick to my tiled shower walls for more than a minute or so without sliding or detaching from the tile when pressed against or pulled on. This is unacceptable for my application needs. I tried properly cleaning the surfaces, but nothing worked. The construction of these handles seemed a bit cheap as well. I sent them back to Amazon and was quickly refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: A hazard
customer_reviews.text: I have previous experience with a suction hand rail (different brand) it was secure and reliable. That is NOT this hand rail. The suction cups are stiffer and only hold for an hour or two before releasing and falling on their own (even without any pressure or use). It is too much of a hazard to risk my safety. If I did not have previous positive experience I would not trust any suction system at all. There seems to be a design flaw with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Charlea Baker

customer_reviews.title: Sorry
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine in the beginning, then after a few weeks it fell off the wall. Don't want a replacement in case it falls off when my husband is holding it & he would fall too! Just fell off the wall and heard a loud thud, went running to see what happened & there it was in the tub. Now it won't suction again. Shucks we really liked it too! Probably just got a lemon boo!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs M

customer_reviews.title: doesn't stay
customer_reviews.text: The first two weeks I had this product I liked it alot. It only came off once, and I thought I had just bumped it. then every other day it has been falling off. I have it on a smooth service inside a shower, vertical position. No matter what I try, it will not stay in place. Everytime I use it, I refasten it so it will be semi-secure and use it immediately. I don't trust it very much now.
customer_reviews.author: MommaRosa8903

customer_reviews.title: It really works
customer_reviews.text: I bought it even after I read some reviews that said its suction doesn't work very well. But I travel a bit and really want something portable that I could take with me so I feel a little steadier in hotel bathrooms. The tiles in the bathroom where I first used it were rough and I didn't think it would stay up at all. It stayed up two or three days at a time and that was all I needed. I'm now using it at home and it has stayed up on my smooth fiberglass enclosure for over a month. I am completely delighted.
customer_reviews.author: Throbble Fleep

customer_reviews.title: That's even worse than nothing at all
customer_reviews.text: Unsafe. Although it's not advertised to suppoert weight, just the fact that it's THERE, in a convenient place to grab, will invite people to grab it when they slip or loose balance. That's even worse than nothing at all. It constantly comes loose and barely supports its own weight. We finally found a use for it - it's i=on our dryer door and we hang a towel from it. We thought we't use it as the dryer door handle, but it's not strong enough for that - but it will hold a towel.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe what they say, the 13.5" may not work with 4" x 4" tiles
customer_reviews.text: Despite the product specifications saying "Tile must be 4" X 4" or greater.", the suction cups did not align with my 4" x 4" tile as shown in the photo, although the 17" bar was closer than the 11.5" bar. For the 17" bar, the distance between the two cups is 13.5", which was close but slightly off and I'm concerned that suction cups touching the grout may reduce the suction power. I will update this review later once I've taken a few showers. Another reason for only 3 stars? Their Lawyers required a warning label and their Accountants cheaped out with a paper-based one that can't be peeled off without a razor blade and Goof Off.
customer_reviews.author: ssalava

customer_reviews.title: Not once has this shower handle failed me
customer_reviews.text: I put this up in my fiberglass tub about two months ago and it has stayed there. Just a flip of the tab while pressed on a clean surface...done! My tub walls are flat and straight and the fact that this handle is suctioned to fiberglass may be why it has never given any trouble. It was well worth the money and I feel more secure now that I have something to hold on to when I feel the need to stabilize myself. I would definitely buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: LambsWool

customer_reviews.title: Permanent grab bars are best
customer_reviews.text: Don't do what I did and purchase this "suction cup device" to save a few dollars over installing real grab bars. No matter how well it sticks to your bathroom shower or tub wall, it will eventually lose its suction and fail. There's real danger when transferring your weight and balance while grabbing the bar and expecting it to hold. I see a few other reviews have brought up the same issue but I am surprised there aren't more. At the very least there should be stronger warnings from the manufacturer and Amazon regarding this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Meni

customer_reviews.title: These handles really suck!
customer_reviews.text: These babies hold on tight and don’t let go! I got two for my mom who is in her 80s, and had a total knee replacement a few weeks ago. She lives in a retirement community, where you can’t alter the property. This is just the ticket! The suction cups are made of super soft and flexible material. The quality is good, and once they were locked on, I pulled away, and down with my full weight, and they did not budge! I will say that I carefully cleaned the tiles with an SOS pad then rinsed, and dried thoroughly. I also avoided any grout lines, as the directions instruct.
customer_reviews.author: M. Andrade

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly on a smooth surface
customer_reviews.text: Read a billion reviews about these. They work just fine on my mother's tub. Note that it's one of those molded tub/wall units, so there are no tiles/grout - all smooth surface - and I cleaned the surface of the tub wall (in the attachment area) first with Zep tile cleaner and then removed the residue with a small amount of alcohol. I attached this to her tub wall about a month ago, and it's still attached - well enough that I can't pull it off, unless I flip the lever.
customer_reviews.author: D. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Dimensions are wrong for 4" tiles!
customer_reviews.text: Product description makes clear the need for 4" minimum tile size to insure solid engagement of suction cups on clear, flat surface. I have such tiles yet there is no way to attach this so that both cups are fully butted against a solid surface. One or the other of the cups will have an edge protruding into the grout area. A quarter inch reduction in length would solve this. Hard to believe this product could survive design, testing(?), manufacture, and sales without some one noticing!
customer_reviews.author: RPB

customer_reviews.title: Works well on molded plastic surface.
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in a molded stall shower enclosure. Pressed it on dry surface with nothing on suction cups. It has stayed in place now for over a month. You may get different results if you are mounting this on a different kind of surface, but in my configuration it works perfectly. Hot water, soapy water and just water from the shower head runs over it regularly and after checking it before each shower, it is still stable and has not moved at all.
customer_reviews.author: Fred in WA

customer_reviews.title: Works As Described
customer_reviews.text: Read many 'low' star reviews citing the shower handle coming loose as the reason. Mine does NOT come loose. BUT I have very smooth shower tiles (and I mean VERY SMOOTH), which allows the suction cups on the handle ends to grip VERY snugly. I can only assume that the reviewers with handles coming loose do not have really smooth tiles. If you need a temporary handle in your shower or near your tub, this handle is a winner. Just make sure before you order that you have ensured that the wall you intend to hang it on has a hard, SMOOTH surface. Blessings and stay safe
customer_reviews.author: prpathaven

customer_reviews.title: Great for balance
customer_reviews.text: I like this product allot for it's convenient way I could move it from one place to another without installing it with screws or anchors. I'm a new amputee and I needed a handle for the bath and shower. This product suction is excellent and it's strong enough I could pull out move the shower surround. I'm 6'2" and strong. Too strong for these handles. I couldn't do pull ups with them, but if I was smaller built and I used them only for balance... They will work great. So I added a mounted bar for getting up and down and I used these suction grips just for balance.
customer_reviews.author: MaddBull

customer_reviews.title: Good way to kill yourself - Impossible to return product
customer_reviews.text: This product would stick to my tile wall for about 40 minutes after engaging the suction cups. After that time it would just slide down the wall. You wouldn't want to risk your life on something that might stick to your wall when you need it. The return policy was ridiculous. They wanted more money for returning and restocking item then it originally cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Buyer_For_21_yrs

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Works VERY WELL, exactly as advertised. Locks to tile shower wall very solidly. I put a very hard tug on it to see it I could move it and was unable to move it. I would not use it for a full body lift out of a shower or tub but the instructions say NOT TO DO THAT. Therefore in my opinion, when used as designed I have confidence in it's safety. So much so that I bought a second one for my 80 something Mother to use in her shower/tub as a support device.
customer_reviews.author: redbaron8

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I usually dont review a product before we actually use it so I hope I'm not eating my words later (will humbly update if that's the case).. but this thing is already AMAZING! I cleaned the tiles with alcohol before installing... I could not believe the suction power and stability it instantaneously has... I pulled..tugged..practically applied all my 125lb weight on it..had my dad jerk on it a few times (hence the reason I bought it).. didnt even wiggle... I took it off and moved it... I almost couldnt get it to release the suction.. EXCELLENT EXCELLENT EXCELLENT! Dad is already relieved and looking forward to a safer shower tomorrow :)
customer_reviews.author: GrammaT

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic suction power
customer_reviews.text: Installed the Safe-er-Grip 11.5" and 17" Balance Assist Bars in the shower/tub area and the suction power is fantastic. The bathroom tiles are not perfectly flat/smooth (has subtle waving designed into the tile), but the handle is able to get a really good grip. My 220+ pound brother even tested one by trying to pull it off the wall. I was afraid he was going to pull the tile off since the bar was not giving up its grip. Don't waste you money or time buying any other brand, you'll just end up returning it (as I did when I tried the AmeriLuck Suction Bath Grab Bar).
customer_reviews.author: kim p.

customer_reviews.title: I put this on tree weeks ago and it still is securely attached to the shower wall.
customer_reviews.text: This is the longer shower handle of the two I purchased. It is also a different brand. I always try a couple different brands and different types . The longer handle is the way to go if space for it is there. Also this brand has never come loose at all in three weeks. The other brand has one suction come loose every 8 to 10 days. As you know that is not too bad because you are supposed to remove the handle every use , clean the surface and reattach before next use. I do not think too many people are doing that. Very satisfied purchase.
customer_reviews.author: brad b

customer_reviews.title: Very Secure...When It Grips
customer_reviews.text: This product is very secure when it decides to grip, but too often one of the suction cups refuses to stay in place.. As a result, I’m always having to re-secure the device w/ some difficulty. In addition, one of the latches on the faulty suction cup doesn’t secure the device as securely as the other one. As stated in my title, when the device is secure it works well, but one side always seems to lose suction. I’ll assume I just received a faulty model & am willing to try it again b/c the price & reviews were so good.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Henry

customer_reviews.title: Quite helpful
customer_reviews.text: I have a hard time getting into the tub shower I have. If I owned the place I would remove this thing. But I rent. I can not even put up the screw in bars. This have been helpful for me getting into and out of the tub. I am afraid of falling as I can not easily lift my legs to step over the edge. I feel much more secure having these bars to assist my balance. I know I can not put my full body weight on them, but I do yank on them and they have stayed secure for me. I have not had them fail, but I do "reattach" them periodically.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Morgan

customer_reviews.title: No Indicator for suction cup engagement.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice feeling bar and very long. I think it's sticking power is fine. One thing I don't like about it vs. my other ones is that this one has no indicator that the suction has failed or is failing. My other ones have little "green / red" windows that indicate that. Right now I just reattach it before shower usage to be safe. The ones with the windows are maintenance free since we can see if they're working.
customer_reviews.author: theRangel

customer_reviews.title: Shower Stability
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the shorter version of this and thought they were the same, not so. I LOVE these longer ones, they are much smoother to put into place and better made than the shorter one that looks the same on Amazon. I have a balance disorder plus as I age my balance is worsening, I was a nurse for 40 years these are FANTASTIC for balancing.!! Please don't use them for pulling up as the directions will tell you, they are for helping with balance and give you comfort that you won't slip and fall in the shower.
customer_reviews.author: KMD

customer_reviews.title: Works great on new tile, but...
customer_reviews.text: This worked great on new smooth dry tile, however, when I transferred it to my father's older tiled shower, it fell off in a few hours. Due to time constraints this won't work and we'll opt for a bar that uses screws. I can't take this kind of chance with someone who just had cardiac surgery and is on anticoagulants.
customer_reviews.author: NYCmom

customer_reviews.title: Must be placed in the perfect spot to work
customer_reviews.text: This would be good it the most proper setting/location but I haven’t found that yet. The tiles in my bathroom are about 50 to 100 years old and are completely flush. No contours or deep grout lines. It will not attach. I put it on the painted wall above the tile, it held for a little bit but in turn, pulled the paint off.
customer_reviews.author: Flip

customer_reviews.title: Forget the suctions install a real screwed into the wall grab bar!
customer_reviews.text: Well overall it was pretty useless. I just installed as instructed and that was easy. I made sure it was placed on smooth tile with no seams etc. I tested the suction too. But when I went to use it to help get up from a seated position in the shower, making sure not to use it as a weight bearing bar, one side of the suction bar came loose and I ended up seated again. Definitely dangerous if I hadn’t been able to sit down again.
customer_reviews.author: ljoy nichols

customer_reviews.title: Refuses to "grip"...  CRASH!
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these grip handles in a shorter size, and they are terrific. Unfortunately, the longer 17" grip will not stay on the wall - any wall - of the shower. I suspect it is simply too heavy. I do know how to install these, and have had great luck with the shorter grips. The 17" is a dud and has been returned.
customer_reviews.author: jgr2

customer_reviews.title: Great Grab Bar!
customer_reviews.text: When we were having our bathroom remodeled I needed a portable grab bar to use in our other shower. I was very leery of how well a grab bar would provide support with suction cups but this thing worked great. After using it a few times in the shower I felt secure & confident that this would provide the support I needed. It worked so well I ordered another one for even greater support & safety. The last thing you want to do is fall in the shower or tub so if you need the support you can't go wrong with this grab bar as long as you follow the easy to use instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: Versatile grab bar has more than one use.
customer_reviews.text: This grab bar does not adhere to my tile tub enclosure well enough for safety. I don't know if it's the bar or the tiles but it comes loose ever so often. Not to waste it, I attached it to the door of my clothes dryer. The clothes dryer door doesn't have a handle, just a slippery little slot that breaks my nails now and then when my hand slips as I pull on it. The grab bar works beautifully on my dryer, it holds to the steel door much better than it did to tile and I haven't broken a fingernail since.
customer_reviews.author: YetiKitty

customer_reviews.title: So far....Pretty darn good
customer_reviews.text: This is not a grab bar intended to support your entire weight. If that's what you need, then consider installing a bar that anchors to a wall stud with screws. As for this bar, I find it great for helping you to keep your balance as you enter and exit the shower. No problem with the install. Seems to be solid with strong suction cups that keeps it in place. No complaints. For those of you who are complaining about the bar not staying in place, I suggest a careful and thorough cleaning of your tile surface before you attempt to install. Also, don't try to install over a tile joint line. That won't work.
customer_reviews.author: NightSky724

customer_reviews.title: Shower grip work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Shower grip works as advertised. I think that if people use them as they are intended, which is for a steady hand to balance and not to pull on they work great. I put a small amount of Vaseline on the grips before applying to a dry wall and they seem to be holding fine. I have another smaller size I have had for years, and I just routinely test them before use with my elderly mother.
customer_reviews.author: mary spre

customer_reviews.title: Use on wooden surface not as good as tile
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for use with my 92-year old mom ... it joined the elevated toilet seat and bed rail that I carry in a suitcase when traveling. I've used this type of devise in the past and it has adhered well to bathroom tile walls. However, the surface to which I was limited in the hotel bathroom on this recent trip was a wide wooden leg that supported the vanity. The devise would stay attached to the wooden surface for 2-4 hours and then fall off. I'm fairly certain that had the surface been tile, the outcome would have been better.
customer_reviews.author: Bfly

customer_reviews.title: Guess these are good for all ages.
customer_reviews.text: Well this is "Daddy's Helper" and now that I've developed nerve issues in my feet I need something to help me stand and am glad for these Grab bars so I can enter and leave my tub or shower stall safely. It stinks to get old but if I want to get older I want to be safe in my shower or tub. These are good and would've given five stars but have only been using them for a short time and will judge their quality over time.
customer_reviews.author: John Jos. S.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great !
customer_reviews.text: Liked the first one of these I purchased, I bought a second one. I was worried that this suction type grab handle would not be secure on the slight texture in my tub/shower enclosure. Attached, solid grip.......2 days later, still holding strong. Ordered another.......Same result. Works perfect for my wife. She had both knees replaced 9 days ago. These suction handles will keep her safe and allow different grip locations as her recovery/rehab progresses.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Summers

customer_reviews.title: The Measurements Are Important
customer_reviews.text: Upon installation, this grab bar seems very sturdy and is long/wide enough, to have room for grabbing quickly (which is why I did not order a 12"). The advertised measurement is 17". The unit is actually 16 3/8", before attaching it to the wall. The box says it is to be used on 4" tiles, so it will line up off the grout lines. My tiles are 3" square. After repositioning it several times, I was able to find a position that did not overlap a grout line. However, it is not at the angle I would prefer.
customer_reviews.author: Connie C.

customer_reviews.title: Strong suction on clean tile
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as described, with very strong suction - IF you follow the instructions first. You MUST first clean the tiles with Windex or similar cleaner. Then line up as best you can, trying to avoid grout lines, having as much tile surface area on the suctions as possible and push down hard. Then clamp each lock down to secure it to the tile. It has worked perfectly so far as a secondary safety handle rather than having to drill another bar. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: I had to have support to help me in and out of the shower and this was a great product to help me balance and have independence
customer_reviews.text: I was in a car accident over the summer and was in the hospital for a month. When I got home, I had to have support to help me in and out of the shower and this was a great product to help me balance and have independence. It can truly be placed anywhere in the shower but I had mine at the edge just for assistance with stepping over the bath ledge. It is sturdy and my sister even hung on it after setting it up to ensure that it was. It’s very easy to install and move as needed. I will definitely repurchase if I ever need one again in the future and would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: K P

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: Works well for what it is! We had to get the longer length handle so that neither of the suction cups would be on a tile-seam in the shower. Since it's suctioned to two full tiles, it works well! The hold is very sturdy and I trust two of these handles to keep my sick Mother safe in the shower. I do remove it and re-suction it before every shower, absolutely recommend doing that as the suction seems to diminish since the last shower. But once it is re-attached, it's just as strong and sturdy as before.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Feel as strong as the shower walls. Worked great after knee replacement surgery.
customer_reviews.text: My spouse had double knee replacements, didn't want a chair, and the shower stall was too small anyway. Two of these made showering safe and without incident. I'm leaving them suctioned to the glass walls - falling in the shower can ruin your whole day. They feel so strongly attached that I believe you could pull the shower stall down before these would let go. When I handle glass and windows on the property I'll put these to use again.
customer_reviews.author: Robko

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my shower
customer_reviews.text: this handle was easy to install and is very sturdy, no worries in grabbing it when coming out of the shower, well worth the price, great quality. one thing, just make sure you push the grip latch to connect on a flat/full tile square, in the center of the tile, it will not stay secure if you grip it on a grout seam.... My shower has small tiles so getting it right in the center of a square was hard but managed to get it gripped securely, must be in the center of a tile or flat wall for a good firm grip where there is no way for it to miss or get air in or underneath it.
customer_reviews.author: SJ Gal

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: This is life changing. I bought this so my husband can easily get in/out of shower/tub after knee replacement. He is is still at a point that he can't this specific shower/tub, so hasn't used it... But I've been using it for stability in and out of shower/tub (our tub is slightly higher than standard) and just love it!! I would've loved to see this product in all white to truly match our bathroom but that's just cosmetic. What important is that it WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.author: StressedMom

customer_reviews.title: Great aid for getting in and out of shower
customer_reviews.text: This shower handle works phenomenally. The package states it isn't designed to be used as a grab bar but I believe that is on the package because of a lawyer wanting to prevent law suits. A 240 lb person uses this every day to get in and out of the shower and no slippage, no sign of movement and with complete confidence it will be assistance. It is mounted on a smooth fiberglass shower wall that was cleaned before applying the handle and it has not moved at all, great device
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, look good
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy, suction was very good, would recommend then for bath/shower use. However I wouldn't feel comfortable without saying that I use them for balance and would not try to put my full weight on them to support myself, nor use them to pull myself up. You really need bolted it supports to use your full weight or to pull yourself up. They are great for what I use them for; balance, and slight support.
customer_reviews.author: Left Head Fred

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: It was used on tile inside of a shower. After testing it, the bottom suction would release. I reattached it and within 15 minutes, it fell off of the wall. I tried it several times with the same result. I likes the feel and shape of the handle; however I couldn't trust it with an elderly person.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect
customer_reviews.text: I started using this type of handle/gripper 5 or 6 years ago. In time, they have to be replaced and I replaced one of mine with this product. I like the sleek design and the suction. I use it for some added stability in the shower. I don't know if it would hold my weight if I fell but it certainly would help the impact be less. As a person approaches his/her 60's, I highly recommend putting a couple of these in the shower/tub area.
customer_reviews.author: MommyHuggin

customer_reviews.title: Quick and effective.
customer_reviews.text: Install two of these and they seem sturdy uncomfortable to use. I can't tell if they will hold the section safely in the future come up but they do look and feel like a reasonably trustworthy. The instructions caution against using it to hang on or for your full weight, which is probably a reasonable warning. They're undoubtedly not as secure device properly anchored into studs behind the wall. But they do the job quickly and very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Walter D. Teague

customer_reviews.title: Takes some extra effort to make them work
customer_reviews.text: I use this product in the shower to assist my 97 year old father-in-law with balance. As you can see, the grout lines are under the 12" gripper and touching the 17" gripper. To get the suction cups to work I wet the wall and then take the grippers and wet the suction cups on the shower floor. Next I press firmly and move the gripper until both cups will grip and lock in place. It takes extra time and effort to make them work.
customer_reviews.author: Lex Rex

customer_reviews.title: They will not stay securely attached for long, be careful.
customer_reviews.text: Within 24 hours after attaching them to a wall they fall off of a smooth shower wall. Strong initial adhesion to the wall can be gained by wetting the wall and the suction cups before applying them to the wall. As the wall water drys the handles lose adhesion and lose holding power until they fall off of the wall. They can be dangerous if you trust them for support if not used immediately after application.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: This is not a safety railing. Especially for older handicapped or heavier people.
customer_reviews.text: I was needing some sturdy handles in my bathtub. I’ve become very disabled and unable to take a bath. I bought these and I use them to suction them to my wall of my tub, but after a couple of hours, I heard them fall off. The suction was not strong enough to hold me and I’m glad that it fell Off before I had the chance to get hurt. But these are not for people who depend on a handicap railing. These are not sturdy enough. They need to be screwed into a beam or a wall.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie.

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good product for apartment living
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product for apartment living, since you can't alter your bathtub with mounting and screwing into the wall like the others it will hold well if you properly clean the area you will apply it to, it has fallen off but can be fixed to stick again, just make sure this part is important that the area you apply it to isn't filmy with soap, that the area is dry, if water gets behind the suction it will fall off on its own or come off or when you use it to help you into the tub,
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L. Martin

customer_reviews.title: ... long time I had it) It's not working so good. It can't be adjusted to the wall
customer_reviews.text: I tried this week for the first time (after a long time I had it) It's not working so good. It can't be adjusted to the wall, even if the wall is totally fine and suppose to be working well. One of the vacuums is not working well Look for other options
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Rabin

customer_reviews.title: Strong suction bar
customer_reviews.text: I am buying my 4th bar. After my hip replacement, I could not take a shower without three of them attached to the walls of the shower. As I healed, I was able to go down to two. My husband liked them so much he put the third in his shower. I just bathed in his shower and realize I need a second one in there. They are easy to attach and unattach and move elsewhere, which I needed to do when I took a bath instead of a shower.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Very effective shower grip  support
customer_reviews.text: The grip arrived as tracked, was well packaged and as described on line. I installed this grip more than a week ago to my ceramic tiles shower (being careful to keep the cups away from the tile seal lines) and it is still firmly attached! I do test it every time I am going to shower as suggested but it is solid as a rock. Great product providing me stability entering, using and exiting the shower.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Halladay

customer_reviews.title: Safety & stability after back surgery.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of the 11" ones and used it while traveling last week. Just what I needed while showering to hold me steady. Very easy to install and remove. IMPORTANT: use according to directions!! A 225 lb. person can not expect it to bear their full weight to haul themselves in and out while staying attached. But it makes a very good hand hold to steady yourself while you shower and wash your hair. Look forward to trying this longer one.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Felix

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: The handle is placed on a smooth, hard surface per manufacturer's instructions. It adheres very well. One cannot depend on it for holding full body weight, but as an assist to getting from sitting on shower chair to pulling upfrom sitting position--it is very secure. May buy another one for other bath/shower.
customer_reviews.author: Nolatune

customer_reviews.title: Bathing so much easier
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I would suggest to pull on it to make sure it is attached. After a time one side might get loose. Just pop the button and push down so suction grips. I can get in and out of my tub easily. Using my whirlpool tub eases my fibromyalgia pain. Well worth it and my home health person okayed it for me to use. Obviously a metal bar is perfection but this to me is an affordable substitute.
customer_reviews.author: Kt

customer_reviews.title: WOW! This product really works.
customer_reviews.text: I was dreading drilling holes through the tile, apprehensive about drilling into a water pipe and causing a bigger problem. So I purchased two of these shower grips a little more than a month ago and install them on a diagonal. They work like a champ and are secure to the wall as the day I installed them. I did clean off the tile with alcohol to make sure there was a good bond between the rubber in the tile. Also I was careful not to overlap the rubber over a grout seam. Would definitely recommend this as a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Mc-queeney

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and seems to work well, but suction cups are a bit too large for the tile
customer_reviews.text: I'm always nervous that these will slip if pulled too hard, but honestly they do seem to suction well. The one little issue I have is that the suction cups are a bit too large for the tiles, so if the handle isn't positioned exactly right, one of the suction cups will overlap the seam of the tile (near the grout) , producing a very slow leak that will eventually release the suction. I would like it better if the cups were just a centimeter smaller in diameter and if the handle length was adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: AndsterManNYCTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best part of my shower!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for my bathroom and bought 3 for gifts for my parents and grandparents. These are the best ones I have ever found!! Strong suction. I absolutely love mine! Nice and long to be able to grab in the shower if you have water in your eyes and reach to find it. A must for anyone who has balance issues in the shower.
customer_reviews.author: GLENDA L.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great If you have the right type of wall
customer_reviews.text: I needed grab bars for my parents shower. Unfortunately at their apartment the fiber glass insert is a raised texture tile pattern, so the bars wouldn't work at first. We bought some smooth glass tiles and adhered them to the insert and then attached the bars to the glass tiles. It was a bit time consuming and a little extra cost. But the bars are sturdy and meet the needs for my mother and father which is the important part. I would purchase again
customer_reviews.author: NightmareKit

customer_reviews.title: Best I have seen or used
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of both positive and negative reviews for this. All I can say is that I'm extremely pleased with it. I'm 6'4" and 280lbs. and have a really bad left knee that doesn't let me stand much so I use a shower chair. I attached it to my shower wall, 4X4 tiles, the day it arrived and it hasn't moved since. I use it to leverage myself out of the chair and it has made it so much easier. Great suction and extremely steady! When I travel it will go with me.
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. Gleason

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase - great suction!
customer_reviews.text: My mom had a pretty bad fall. After she was released from the hospital, I needed to adjust her house/way of living while she recovers. Ramps, railings, and shower safety. I purchased these to place in her shower (at 2 points). They work great and the suction power relieves any worry I had. Also, they're very large and sturdy -- able to get a really good grip. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Soper

customer_reviews.title: Get a GRIP!
customer_reviews.text: We are 71 years of age and I really did NOT want to drill holes in our shower wall. This " Lifestyles Safe-er-Grip 17" Bath & Shower Handle" is "rock solid". Now as a caution: The tiles MUST be smooth, clean and the suction cups MUST NOT overlap any grout lines. My wife has been using this grip for 2+ weeks now... 10/31/19 UPDATE: This grip has been on for months now and has NEVER come off!
customer_reviews.author: R. Leven

customer_reviews.title: It's so safe and very secure.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact when you take a bath with softeners or bubble bath that sometimes, even with a bath mat it's sometimes slippery. I had surgery on my foot last year, so this grip handle makes it so much easier to get in and out of the tub very safe. I highly recommend this for anyone who has the slightest bit of trouble getting in and out of the tub. Like a dream come true for a bath girl!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Diane Standish

customer_reviews.title: Home Health Aide for 15 + Years...The Solution is here...Lose The Anxiety
customer_reviews.text: I have a Patient that is at Leat 6 foot plus and in the ranch style shower the family has he had to Hunch Down and the Placement of his hands only on the shower chair and my support. i recommended a bar and I found this bar, fast delivery I used it today, REAL improvement , but not exact si I am ordering another for improved "Steps" into the shower so much more safely. Recommended Highly
customer_reviews.author: marty cohen

customer_reviews.title: These grab bars are an important safety device
customer_reviews.text: I installed two grab bars on the tile surround of my tub/shower and as long as each suction end is located off the grout seams and on smooth, clean tile, they hold powerfully. I doubt these would work on small mosaic tiles. I’m 73, weigh 130 lbs and use these to pull up to a standing position from a bath. My tile is gray and these grab bars are quite attractive and very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Word of Mouth

customer_reviews.title: Great design, but they failed to stick after 24 hours.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these, with its clever design, overall good feel to the handles and overall look, let alone great price, but they kept coming loose from the bathroom shower wall after a day. I made sure the suction was not oerlapping the tile seams, I made sure to clean the surface of our tiles, which were flat and glossy, I even cleaned the rubber suction cups and at one point, spread a thin coat of a vaselline along the edges to keep the seal... But after a day, without luck, one side would come loose. Now, it takes no time to lift the latch and reseal it on the tile, but I should not have to do that.
customer_reviews.author: David Nadas

customer_reviews.title: It was time
customer_reviews.text: Falling is not a good thing, even if you are not old. When we remodeled our bathrooms, cultured marble was our choice for the surrounds. The new surrounds did not have a towel rack or other protrusion to use to have a means of supporting yourself in the shower. These are a nice addition that were simple to install and are extremely secure. Very nice product that works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Quarles

customer_reviews.title: Quick, Easy, and Secure
customer_reviews.text: We installed this for showering after hip replacement surgery, and wished we had thought to get one during the months of arthritis pain leading up to the operation because it’s so handy. The grip is strong, but I wouldn’t pull it directly away from the suction. We check it before getting into the shower, and use it for climbing into and out of the tub shower. It stays clean.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy10

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: It's probably going to take several tries at positioning this grab bar just where you want it. But once it's in place it stays there. I've had no issues with it coming loose. It's tight and feels very secure. My only minor complaint is that the bumpy rubber grip on the inside doesn't go the whole length of the handle so you always have to make sure you're grabbing it in the middle. Otherwise, it's a gem.
customer_reviews.author: John Gazurian

customer_reviews.title: STRONGER THAN LIFE
customer_reviews.text: I PLACED THIS PRODUCT ON MY EXPENSIVE TILE BECAUSE I WAS UNSURE IS THE HANDLE/RAIL WOULD LOOK UNATTRACTIVE. I DID NOT WANT ANYTHING PERMANENT. IT IS NOT UNATTRACTIVE, AND SERVES ITS PURPOSE. THE SUCTION IS STRONG, VERY VERY STRONG. AND THE GRIPS ARE COMFORTABLE TO THE TOUCH. I REALLY STAND BY THIS PRODUCT. IT CAN BE PORTABLE FOR HOTEL VISITS, AND MOVED TO VARIOUS BATH AND SHOWERS AS NEEDED.
customer_reviews.author: Yashika

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I installed this bath/shower handle on each end of the entrance to my tub enclosure, in order to give me stability/safty getting in and out of the shower. I needed this for showering after hip replacement surgery. It's given me confidence and security that I won't fall and injure myself getting in and out of the shower. Note: I am a 130 lb woman and I'm only exerting enough "pull" to secure my footing.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Adaptive use as dryer door handle.  Works great!  Intended to be temporary but has become a permanent fixture.
customer_reviews.text: Great adaptive product. Needed a better/easier way to open a flat fronted dryer door for several weeks. As purchased, our dryer door has to be opened and closed by pushing or pulling exactly at the center of a low and small built in handle. This 17" long grip serves as a handle across the top of the dryer door. It is now a permanent fixture. Has never lost suction, and the dryer is easy to open and shut with hand or hip. In the long haul, the distribution of force should also lenthgen the lifespan of the dryer door catch.
customer_reviews.author: new50

customer_reviews.title: Don't assume it's holding tight
customer_reviews.text: I love this product; it makes it so much easier to get in and out of the bathtub without losing balance. However, though I've had no problems, as a safety precaution, as the instructions direct, I always check to make sure it is still gripping tightly to the wall before I grab hold. It's been up for over a month and no problem and I have not had to readjust it.
customer_reviews.author: SLJ

customer_reviews.title: I use these for my 89 year old mother in the tub
customer_reviews.text: I have found the length of this suction handle to most appropriately fit the tile squares in the bathroom (some smaller sizes do not fit properly). Once the surface areas and suction surfaces are clean, the handle works for perfectly for ensuring her safety and holding up to her weight. I would advise cleaning both surfaces periodically as mold will eventually build up in these areas, thus weakening the suction strength. Should the surface area on the handle become too moldy or too dirty, I would recommend purchasing another handle. The risks are simply too great!
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: These grip bars are super strong and I love that you can move them to fit your needs.
customer_reviews.text: I take care of my mother so I bought two of these suction bars to go in her shower. I also bought a shower chair. So I put the bars where I thought they would help her the most. One day she fell and could not find anything to grip on to to help pull herself up. I moved the suction bars and put them in different places until she was able to stand. Those bars are really strong and being able to move them made a bad situation so much better. I would recommend these suction bars because they really saved my mother that day.
customer_reviews.author: Dona Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Wow! This is just what I needed !
customer_reviews.text: This safety bar was an exceptional purchase. It was packaged well, and is quite larger than I expected, but that is a good thing ! Was so EASY to put on my tiled bath shower combo. I now feel secure that I won't trip over the top of my tub to get into my shower. It is also SIMPLE to remove, if you want to put it in another place. GREAT value as well !! VERY happy with my purchase !!
customer_reviews.author: Dhaynes

customer_reviews.title: Safer Shower!
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my mom's shower with this great gripper. Placed horizontally it allows for a comfortable, safe grip to enhance stability and safety for someone with balance issues. Her previous shower grips were not safe due to deteriorating rubber and a tricky aspect of sometimes working, sometimes not. I gave these a try and put them through a tough number of tests before deeming them safe enough, including trying to yank them off the shower wall. It didn't budge, and Mom went on to feel secure and supported in and out of the shower with these great grips. I'll definitely be buying another for when we travel. A great investment in safety and security with ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Geneva Mae Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great for smooth, tiled baths
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this because I was having total hip replacement surgery and needed more stability in the shower. I already had 2 shorter ones, I needed a longer one for the back wall but didn't want anything permanent. If our shower weren't a pieced shower, it would have worked better. It works on the side walls well though, a tiled bath it would be great as long as there isn't texture.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: worked great
customer_reviews.text: I've had 12 surgeries on my left knee. Falling is my greatest fear and a big NO NO from the doctor. Getting in and out of the shower was something that gave me anxiety everyday. Now I have a nice handle to grab hold of and steady myself. Worth every penny. It sticks well and does not slip. I am thrilled to have this. i did buy 2 of these in different sizes. Either one would have been enough. But my sense of safety is worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Kincaid

customer_reviews.title: I use them on the edge of my hot tub
customer_reviews.text: As a woman in her 70's I was nervous getting in and out of my hot tub. There was no handle and the edges are slick. I got this suction handle and simply put it on the top edge of the hot tub near the steps and hold on entering and leaving. The suction is perfect. It's easy to put on and off. I keep it on the table next to my hot tub when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Ptown JHO

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a smooth surface
customer_reviews.text: These suction grip handrails a great when the surface of the wall is smooth. Unfortunately, many hotels have started using a textured surface on the tiles they have installed in their baths, preventing the suction grips from adhering. Since we purchased these to travel with when an ADA room is unavailable, they have not proven as useful as we had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: I’m Justnita

customer_reviews.title: Safety Grab Bar!!! Amazing suction and grip
customer_reviews.text: My 76 year old Mom moved in with us recently and our shower walls are made of fiberglass so we cant drill into the material. I got these yesterday and placed one in my moms bathroom (she had a stroke and has weakness) for added safety. I am so impressed by the strong suction. My mom weighs 170lbs. I tested it and feel confident that it will provide the best possible safety for my mom. I even put one in my bathroom for added safety. I am definately buying one more. These are super strong and safe.
customer_reviews.author: Evette Soon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to attach to shower wall and work great
customer_reviews.text: Mom came to visit and her mobility and balance are not what they once were. Instead of paying to have some fairly ugly handles installed in our showers and bathroom, we thought we'd give these a shot. They work as described and Mom loved having the extra handholds. Super easy to install and they provided extra stability and allowed her privacy to shower instead of having us stand by. You can take the handle with you on trips as well. Bonus! It packs small.
customer_reviews.author: MG from AZ

customer_reviews.title: very effective at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Us seniors have a lot of retrofitting sometimes to make a house safer. This is a very cost effective way of helping. I would not want to in any way penetrate the walls of a fiberglass shower insert abut needed to add bars of some kind. These are simple and the suction is surprisingly good. I have had one for over a year and it is as good as the day I bought it. This review is for the second one I just bought. I imagine it would work just as well on tile if placed right.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Burris

customer_reviews.title: Great product & holds position nicely
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my mother, who is 90 and needs something to hang onto getting into and out of the shower. At first, I was skeptical if this would hold onto the wall well enough. Pleasantly surprised when I attached it to the tub wall. It's plenty strong & not real easy to move around unless you get the suction cups lifted up a bit. So make sure of your placement before clamping it down in place.
customer_reviews.author: Rhapsody

customer_reviews.title: Could be dangerous? Did not adhere!
customer_reviews.text: This product did not adhere to the shower for 30 seconds! The shower wall is smooth and clean. I mounted it, seemed easy enough. By the time the shower warmed up, it shot off the wall and landed on the floor! I tried multiple times. Same results every time. I rarely give a bad review, this product deserves it. I believe it could be dangerous for anyone counting on it to be reliable. It was not. I didn’t even bother to return the hunk of junk. It was not worth the trouble. My recommendation is.... don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: judy

customer_reviews.title: Works great on the correct type of tile.
customer_reviews.text: Works on flat bathroom tiles and not on uneven ceramic tile. The safer-grip suction didn’t stay on to the tile to the left as it was not flat. It stays well on the tile to the right.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Works as Stated
customer_reviews.text: A first the grips didn't stay on the shower walls longer than an hour or two. I cleaned the wall with Softscrub and alcohol. Then attached the grips. They have been up since then. That was about 3 weeks ago. They have not come down. The shower is a tub/shower fiberglass combination. I had to make sure I applied them were there were no ripples in the wall. I have been very pleased with the grips.
customer_reviews.author: Neal W.

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This handle was perfect, easy to install and unlike competing products, it has stayed attached for months! My wife uses this for stability when in the shower, she knows not to put a lot of weight on it, as it is held up by tow large suction cups. When she is dizzy it helps her to rapidly orient herself so that she doesn't fall.
customer_reviews.author: collector-magazines

customer_reviews.title: Suction is not reliable!
customer_reviews.text: I have learned after a few mishaps (which luckily did not result in falls, but were quite scary none-the-less) that I must push DOWN on the handle - and not pull OUT, which is your natural inclination. If you pull out (toward you), you can't be certain that it will hold - sometimes it does, other times not. I will be replacing it with a permanent fixture and, in the meantime, with great care and forethought. I am particularly disappointed as it is an "Amazon's Choice", which I will no longer take so strongly as an indicator of quality!
customer_reviews.author: KATHERINE WHIPPLE

customer_reviews.title: Better than you might think!  You need to buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing like I expected regarding the suction cups. Not like you have in your sink for your brushes etc. these suction cups (2) are on each end of the handle & are the size of the round total handle ends. Looks like you won’t need much maintenance. Also has clips on top of handle on each end for easy application off & on! Strong too!!! I will be ordering more!
customer_reviews.author: Shez2bad

customer_reviews.title: Great suction & solid temporary handle!
customer_reviews.text: Works great & has stayed on my shower wall for over a month! I'm 300lbs & I wouldn't trust it to hold all of my weight but it's pretty secure. I slipped getting out & it stopped me from falling. I do constantly check it though because it's not permanent but keep shower clean & it'll stay.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Limited success adhering to stone
customer_reviews.text: The grip would not afix to the natural stone tile in the shower and we were only successful in adhering it to the safety glass walls of the shower. We did not like having the pressure on glass and never fully trusted the adhering power of the grip. It did serve a purpose by creating a place to steady oneself, but we were not counting on it to pull oneself up or depending on putting full weight on the grip.
customer_reviews.author: Linda F. H.

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous faulty gadget.
customer_reviews.text: This item would have cost me to dislocate a hip I had just replaced !!! Three weeks after surgery I bought it. I had my Occupational therapist install it. An hour later I found it at the bottom of my bathtub. Did the same with my PT lady. My tub has NO tiles ! It is flat. I then had a neighbor who happen to be a Doctor to come in and install it. He did. I found it on the tub floor yet again ! All i say with trepidation is that I am ever so happy I did not lean on it to get into my tub !! You need to take it off the market
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very secure!
customer_reviews.text: I put mine a few months ago and since I’ve taken several showers and this handle has not move from it’s place. I’ve lean on it, hold myself to stand and it has hold my weight (168 lbs) Sometimes my legs don’t work that good so this little handle can hold me pretty good. I will be getting a couple more for my other bathroom/bathtub.
customer_reviews.author: Laurili2

customer_reviews.title: Would not hold on tile wall ... keep slipping
customer_reviews.text: I really had hopes for these no-slip, tight, safe grip handles. They are large enough - however, both of them would not hold on the tile (smooth) wall longer than 30-45 minutes. They would start to slip about 10 minutes after installing. Had to re-install to use each time getting into the out of tub. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Just Mike's Opinion

product_meta.title: Changing Lifestyles Safe-er-Grip 16" Bath & Shower Handle
product_meta.description:

The Safe er Grip assists your balance while entering or exiting the tub or shower full body weight is not to be applied to product. This easy to install grip gives both parent and child steady confidence in and around the tub.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER

Simply press the tab levers to securely attach
Can be used on shower walls too
Easy to install and remove just flip the tabs
Tile needs to be smooth and non-porous.
Tiles should be 4x4,Ghost White with gray accents
